apis.description:
Returns the data for a single group, or a 401 if the caller doesn't have
the rights to see it.

the rights to see it.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: - "permissions": Include permissions the current user has for the group.

apis.description:
Creates a new group. Groups created using the "/api/v1/groups/"
endpoint will be community groups.

operations.notes:
Creates a new group. Groups created using the "/api/v1/groups/"
endpoint will be community groups.

parameters.name: is_public
parameters.description: whether the group is public (applies only to community groups)

parameters.name: storage_quota_mb
parameters.description: The allowed file storage for the group, in megabytes. This parameter is ignored if the caller does not have the manage_storage_quotas permission.

apis.description:
Creates a new group. Groups created using the "/api/v1/groups/"
endpoint will be community groups.

operations.notes:
Creates a new group. Groups created using the "/api/v1/groups/"
endpoint will be community groups.

parameters.name: is_public
parameters.description: whether the group is public (applies only to community groups)

parameters.name: storage_quota_mb
parameters.description: The allowed file storage for the group, in megabytes. This parameter is ignored if the caller does not have the manage_storage_quotas permission.

apis.description:
Modifies an existing group.  Note that to set an avatar image for the
group, you must first upload the image file to the group, and the use the
id in the response as the argument to this function.  See the
{file:file_uploads.html File Upload Documentation} for details on the file
upload workflow.

operations.notes:
Modifies an existing group.  Note that to set an avatar image for the
group, you must first upload the image file to the group, and the use the
id in the response as the argument to this function.  See the
{file:file_uploads.html File Upload Documentation} for details on the file
upload workflow.

parameters.name: is_public
parameters.description: Whether the group is public (applies only to community groups). Currently you cannot set a group back to private once it has been made public.

parameters.name: avatar_id
parameters.description: The id of the attachment previously uploaded to the group that you would like to use as the avatar image for this group.

parameters.name: storage_quota_mb
parameters.description: The allowed file storage for the group, in megabytes. This parameter is ignored if the caller does not have the manage_storage_quotas permission.

apis.description: Deletes a group and removes all members.

operations.notes: Deletes a group and removes all members.

apis.description:
Follow this group. If the current user is already following the
group, nothing happens. The user must have permissions to view the
group in order to follow it.

Responds with a 401 if the user doesn't have permission to follow the
group.

operations.notes:
Follow this group. If the current user is already following the
group, nothing happens. The user must have permissions to view the
group in order to follow it.

Responds with a 401 if the user doesn't have permission to follow the
group.

apis.description:
Stop following this group. If the current user is not already
following the group, nothing happens.

operations.notes:
Stop following this group. If the current user is not already
following the group, nothing happens.

apis.description:
Sends an invitation to all supplied email addresses which will allow the
receivers to join the group.

operations.notes:
Sends an invitation to all supplied email addresses which will allow the
receivers to join the group.

parameters.name: invitees
parameters.description: An array of email addresses to be sent invitations.

apis.description: Returns a list of users in the group.

operations.notes: Returns a list of users in the group.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The partial name or full ID of the users to match and return in the results list. Must be at least 3 characters.

apis.description:
Upload a file to the group.

This API endpoint is the first step in uploading a file to a group.
See the {file:file_uploads.html File Upload Documentation} for details on
the file upload workflow.

Only those with the "Manage Files" permission on a group can upload files
to the group. By default, this is anybody participating in the
group, or any admin over the group.

operations.notes:
Upload a file to the group.

This API endpoint is the first step in uploading a file to a group.
See the {file:file_uploads.html File Upload Documentation} for details on
the file upload workflow.

Only those with the "Manage Files" permission on a group can upload files
to the group. By default, this is anybody participating in the
group, or any admin over the group.

apis.description:
Leave a group if you are allowed to leave (some groups, such as sets of
course groups created by teachers, cannot be left). You may also use 'self'
in place of a membership_id.

operations.notes:
Leave a group if you are allowed to leave (some groups, such as sets of
course groups created by teachers, cannot be left). You may also use 'self'
in place of a membership_id.

apis.description:
Leave a group if you are allowed to leave (some groups, such as sets of
course groups created by teachers, cannot be left). You may also use 'self'
in place of a membership_id.

operations.notes:
Leave a group if you are allowed to leave (some groups, such as sets of
course groups created by teachers, cannot be left). You may also use 'self'

name.description: The display name of the group.

description.description: A description of the group. This is plain text.

is_public.description: Whether or not the group is public.  Currently only community groups can be made public.  Also, once a group has been set to public, it cannot be changed back to private.

followed_by_user.description: Whether or not the current user is following this group.

join_level.description: How people are allowed to join the group.  For all groups except for community groups, the user must share the group's parent course or account.  For student organized or community groups, where a user can be a member of as many or few as they want, the applicable levels are 'parent_context_auto_join', 'parent_context_request', and 'invitation_only'.  For class groups, where students are divided up and should only be part of one group of the category, this value will always be 'invitation_only', and is not relevant. * If 'parent_context_auto_join', anyone can join and will be automatically accepted. * If 'parent_context_request', anyone  can request to join, which must be approved by a group moderator. * If 'invitation_only', only those how have received an invitation my join the group, by accepting that invitation.

members_count.description: The number of members currently in the group

avatar_url.description: The url of the group's avatar

context_type.description: The course or account that the group belongs to. The pattern here is that whatever the context_type is, there will be an _id field named after that type. So if instead context_type was 'account', the course_id field would be replaced by an account_id field.

role.description: Certain types of groups have special role designations. Currently, these include: 'communities', 'student_organized', and 'imported'. Regular course/account groups have a role of null.

group_category_id.description: The ID of the group's category.

storage_quota_mb.description: the storage quota for the group, in megabytes

permissions.description: optional: the permissions the user has for the group. returned only for a single group and include[]=permissions

id.description: The id of the membership object

group_id.description: The id of the group object to which the membership belongs

user_id.description: The id of the user object to which the membership belongs

workflow_state.description: The current state of the membership. Current possible values are 'accepted', 'invited', and 'requested'

moderator.description: Whether or not the user is a moderator of the group (the must also be an active member of the group to moderate)

just_created.description: optional: whether or not the record was just created on a create call (POST), i.e. was the user just added to the group, or was the user already a member
